New Records: Ireland set up its first T20 win over Pakistan.
Key Match Events: Curtis Campher ran a leg bye off the penultimate ball for Ireland to stun Pakistan by five wickets.
Craig Young conceded only 27 runs and dug out Babar Azam and Azam Khan in the same over.
Iftikhar Ahmed scored an unbeaten 37, including 17 in the last over.
Andy Balbirnie anchored the Irish with 77 off 55 balls including 10 boundaries.
Balbirnie and Harry Tector took Ireland past 100.
Campher knocked off the remaining runs with 15 from seven balls.
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Paul Stirling said, 'We were happy to chase 180.'
